revised_title: Neural Responses and Binocular Interactions in Owl Monkey Visual Cortex
tldr: The study investigates the response properties of cells in the middle temporal area (area MT) of owl monkey visual cortex. It found that most cells in area MT are orientation- and direction-selective, and revealed a powerful range of binocular interactions. The research provides insights into the functional specialization of the prestriate cortex in owl monkeys.
